item.title: Bar Plots
item.description: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) Bar plots are representations of data by using rectangular bars. Here is a bar plot of the MLB 1980 Team Homerun Distribution. In this distribution, we flipped the x and y axes with the coord_flip() command. query<-"SELECT name,HR FROM Teams WHERE yearID=1980 ORDER BY HR" result<-sqldf(query) result$name<-factor(result$name,levels=result$name) ggplot()+ geom_bar(data=result,aes(x=name,y=HR),stat='identity',color="blue",fill="white")+ coord_flip()+ ylab("Homeruns")+ xlab("Teams")+ ggtitle("1980 Team Homerun Distribution")

item.title: Histograms
item.description: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) A histogram is a diagram consisting of rectangles whose area is proportional to the frequency of a variable and whose width is equal to the class interval. If we want, we can make a histogram of player weights for the Master table. query<-"SELECT weight FROM Master" result<-sqldf(query) ggplot()+ geom_histogram(data=result,aes(x=weight),color="blue",fill="black",bins=50)+ ggtitle("Body Weight Distribution for Baseball Players")

item.title: Time Series
item.description: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) A time series allows you to visualize data over time. It is similar to a time series. # Extraction---------------------------- query<-"SELECT yearID,HR FROM Batting WHERE playerID='ruthba01'" result<-sqldf(query) # Visualization------------------------- ggplot()+ #geom_point(data=result,aes(x=yearID,y=HR))+ geom_line(data=result,aes(x=yearID,y=HR))+ ggtitle("Ruth's Homerun Totals Throughout the Years")+ xlab("Year")+ ylab("Homeruns")
